page.title: 02FARMING - HOME FARM
page.content: The land surrounding Englefield House makes up the Home Farm. This is farmed by a family partnership. There is an overall farm manager who is responsible for the arable and the livestock aspects of the farm. The arable unit is staffed by a foreman and four tractor drivers. The cropping includes winter wheat, winter barley and winter oats as well as oil-seed rape, peas, grass and sugar-beet for seed. All these crops are combinable. Maize, Lucerne and temporary and permanent grass are grown for conservation and grazing. They also grow enough food for the livestock and supply them with straw. The livestoock unit includes 120 pedigree Guernseys at Mayridge Farm and 150 Friesians at Bournfield. It is staffed by a dairyman, stockman and two other workers.
